description: From New Latin, from Ancient Greek σῶμα (sôma, “body”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The whole axial portion of an animal, including the head, neck, trunk, and tail.
The corporeal body, as distinguished from the psyche or soul and the pneuma or spirit.
(cytology) The bulbous part of a neuron, containing the cell nucleus.

description: Transliteration of Sanskrit सोम (soma). Doublet of haoma.

entries.meaning: (Vedic religion) A ritual drink in ancient Vedic culture, obtained by pressing the Soma plant.
examples: Once he had drunk the intoxicating soma, he experienced an ascent to the gods without having to die a violent death, as in the old ritual.

entries.meaning: (by extension, science fiction) Any kind of intoxicating drug.
